column5: Ok dont be to critical on some of the imformation I have in this. It,s mostly from what I had learned and did. I know theres errors.Just sharing.  I,ll just post the scanned pics. Easy on the me ok,,,,,,,,,                        Nice boot for brudder Memart.Rainbow hit just as the light was coming up. PortCredit                Andy,This is the place I was tell you about.The same place your buddy hunts deer.                        Anyhoo thats it.I gave up on it as I was fishing alot and didnt take the time to continue it.Wish I did.  Ok fire away.
Lots of old memories in there Brian...  LOVE the rhymes Brian !!!
Oct 22 1986 you caught a 107 lbs brown!!!!  Neat montage,  thanks for sharing

Do ya have kids ? If so, this would be a wonderful lagacy to leave them when the time comes. I like it alot, what a great idea. It takes devotion to take the time to write everything down like that. Hats off to you Bud !!!  Paul

This is one of the best posts I've seen on any fishing site. You are a good fisherman and a GREAT POET!! I can't decide which poem is the best... they are all awesome.  One of my faves:  Salmon The King Chinook may give us a fight But the Coho is a beautiful sight We have the Pink and the Atlantic But Lets not get in a frantic They're all in the Lakes for us to see except for the Sockeye which lives in the sea
Hey, you did a lot of salmon/steelhead fishing back in the day!  Some nice memories there Brian.

Wow Brian didn't know you fish so much in the past.... I'm stunned     Those are some great memories as far as keeping a log  This one is hung up in my office too, real close to where I sit    And keep telling anyone coming in that I'm contagious and to not provoke me Thanks for sharing Jacques

I thought that was cool to look at. You had some great days out on the water. We should all do something like that. It seems that all the days on the water seem to blend together and I cant remember which day was which. My favorite poem that made me laugh..... Perch "Get the skillet and the butter Ill go call my Dad and Mother Hi I got the butter in the hot skillet So come on over and have some Perch fillets"

Thanks guys.  Thought I would share.   Mike I pretty much lived and breathed it back then.Browns mostly.After the last year of that book,I was probly gone every weekend. Loved the niagara area. We would leave at 3 am just so we could stand at the Dam in deluise (sp?) The walk up and down from the whirlpool was always an adventure. Believe it or not,I used the same rod and reel for all those years. 12 hellbender and a black cardnial 3.Still have it,except a few inches shorter.  Thanks again.  Im trying to find a few boxes that contain pics,of the niagara area.
What a walk down memory lane for you Brian.  That was really cool!!!  Joey
